definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: That dragon lady have three gigolo under her husbands nose.
sentences.chinese: 那位女強人當着丈夫的面，公開有三位小白臉。

sentences.english: If your wife is a superwoman, will you have any pressure?
sentences.chinese: 如果家裏有個女強人老婆，你會不會有壓力呢？

sentences.english: But speaking as a friend of House, he seems to be attracted to strong women.
sentences.chinese: 作爲豪斯的朋友我敢說他更容易被女強人吸引。

sentences.english: The past month has seen a flurry of female firsts in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的一個月中，日本突然湧現出了一批女強人。

sentences.english: That dragon lady told her husband she had three gigolos to his face.
sentences.chinese: 那位女強人當着她丈夫的面，公開有三位小白臉。

sentences.english: There is no need to be a superman or superwoman all the time (even if you want to be one then you can still take a small break from being super).
sentences.chinese: 你沒有必要一直做一個超人或是女強人。

definition: a good wife and loving mother
well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well
independent and autonomous (idiom); self-determination/to act independently/to maintain control over one's own affairs
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
to get married and have kids/to start a family
third category movie (containing sexual or violent content)
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
